intro: Aethionema creticum, commonly known as Cretan sandthorn, is a small, flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its yellow flowers are borne in clusters and bloom in the spring. It is often found in coastal areas and is considered a hardy, drought-resistant species.
